storyInfo: Kal'tsit defends the three hunters before the Inquisitor, securing their exit from Sal Viento. Having arrived back at Rhodes Island, Gladiia learns of a change.

attributes.content: Dr. Kal'tsit, I would like an explanation.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor

attributes.content: I knew things weren't as simple as they seemed...
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: The Inquisition is simply keeping too many more secrets than the Iberian people deserve to know.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: My lady, need I remind you that spreading rumors and hearsay is strictly forbidden in Iberia?
attributes.name: High Inquisitor

attributes.content: High Inquisitor, I'm only saying this because you already know those secrets.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: The Church of the Deep has infiltrated Iberia and is taking root here in secret.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: They took advantage of the relationship you once had with the sea. Abandoned Iberian cities have become the beachhead for the Church of the Deep's encroachment onto dry land.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: They have their own interpretations of your scriptures, and they use them to bend your will. They also hide well. With so many irons in the fire, there was never any way for you to attend to all of it.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: So... you should cry out for help. If you continue this pointless war of territory and faith, we will miss our one chance.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.text: The Hunters and the Inquisitor find themselves in a peculiar face off with Kal

attributes.content: Your Honor, Iberians are different.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: The skyline that you see every day is different from what everyone else who walks this world sees.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: What do you call the place where you live every day and night? The coast.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Other peoples live on land, while Iberians live by the coast.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: For the majority of the population, whether they live in the wilderness or the cities, their sightlines are the sky above and an endless swath of land and mountains ahead.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Anything above the clouds means nothing.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: When they talk about 'the world', they refer to these lands alone.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: The land on which they live is the world to them, because they've decided there is nothing in this world beyond these lands.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Whether residing in sealed-off cities, out-of-the-way villages, or hostile wilderness, they believe in what they see, and nothing else.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Now look at them again. These Abyssal Hunters. These Ægir.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: The ocean is vast in ways beyond the land.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Iberia is not like other countries.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Those who reside on land are obsessed with their ways and their authorities. They overlook the infinite possibilities, and the opportunities to explore the boundaries that they blindly choose to ignore.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Your world is far more complete. You understand both the land and the sea. Iberia has a much better knowledge of its place in the world than anyone else.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: This has given you a huge lead over everyone in the past.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: That is enough.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor

attributes.content: This is all water under the bridge. The radiance of the cities has faded, and Iberia is nothing but a pile of rubble today.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor

attributes.content: What a surprise. I thought you would dodge the subject.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: You are here, and you are certainly not blind. Look out and see for yourself.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor

attributes.content: Cities like Sal Viento line the entire Iberian coastline.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor

attributes.content: Iberia was once a prosperous nation, but how many of these ruins can be found here today?
Kal'tsit knows, and naturally the High Inquisitor knows too. However, with the High Inquisitor's steely composure, it is impossible to discern any kind of emotion from his expression whatsoever.
Furthermore, he is wearing a mask.
If they could cry, then the Iberians would definitely cry. If they could laugh, then the Iberians would definitely laugh out loud.
Yet here stands one such impassioned Iberian, who has since turned into the emotionless man before her.
Without expression and without emotion. Iberia's golden age has passed into a life of tranquility.
There are too many.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor

attributes.content: We cannot support them, and many cities are unable to support themselves.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor

attributes.content: Ever since the Profound Silence Iberia is not what it once was.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor

attributes.content: Then you need the support of others all the more.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: No one knows what happened to Iberia, and no one may know.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor

attributes.content: Because Iberia was once on the brink of total destruction?
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Even now, Iberia cannot be destroyed.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor

attributes.content: You are still here, and so are the Iberian people.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: I believe that even if not a single city remained...
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Iberia's citizens won't give up so easily.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: High Inquisitor, please allow me.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Pride and prejudice have destroyed the Ægir. This land must not repeat the mistakes of the deep sea folk.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: If Iberia falls to the aftershock of this disaster, then there will no longer be anyone who knows the true face of the sea, and the horror of the threat it poses.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Just like a certain hunt in the tundra roughly a century ago. It is the territory of mankind that we are guarding, not the honor and reputation of a nation, against the sea monsters, and against anything else.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Besides, if Iberia keeps lingering on with its last breath...
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: In that case, Iberia will one day meet its fate.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: As of now, you can still rebuild your homeland, rebuild Iberia.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: I don't believe that.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor

attributes.content: My objective isn't to get you to see things my way.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: This question has to be answered, and a decision has to be made. It doesn't necessarily need to be answered by you, nor does it have to be now.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: We still must resolve the Sal Viento affair.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor

attributes.text: The High Inquisitor looks at the hunters.

attributes.content: One of them will have to stay.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor

attributes.content: I will.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: You two need to go back.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Kal'tsit, we will do as we discussed. I won't be there to lead them, so you will have to take my place.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: You...?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: What's this supposed to mean?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: High Inquisitor, perhaps I can take their place?
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: I can serve as a proxy for them in your interrogations. I can straighten out the details of the events that transpired here, and you will get the information that you need.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: I can survive an Iberian prison.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: If you insist.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor

attributes.content: Lady Kal'tsit?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Doctor...?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: You want me to expel them from our territory?
attributes.name: High Inquisitor

attributes.content: For now at the very least.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: The three of you—
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Go back to Rhodes Island. Misery will pick you up near the northeastern border. Don't take the waterways this time.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: The Inquisition will determine the route they will take.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor

attributes.content: As long as the destination remains unchanged, you may route them however you want.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: When will you come back? I can't wait for you too long.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: That is not for her to decide.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor

attributes.content: Let's not jump to conclusions yet, little birdie of Iberia. A prison's walls are as paper to me.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Gladiia, no.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: So you want me to watch him take you away?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: That's right.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Don't worry about me, Gladiia.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Now go, hunters. Surely a heart-to-heart with Specter must be on the agenda. Now that she's awake, she can give you the answers you've always wanted. Her own answers.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: And you have nothing to say to me? This is a rare opportunity for everyone, yourself included.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Hmm...
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: I'm afraid I don't have any suitable advice for a hunter like you.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Am I too hasty for your liking?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: No, but you understand your own situation far better than I.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: In any case, I don't know how much longer you can maintain your current state... Though I suppose that's the least of your worries.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: How do you know?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Just a hunch. You are in a good mood, after all. I'm sure it matters to you very little whether you are awake or not, Specter. After all, the way things are now is not that bad for you.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: You needn't tell me. Nothing has ever been completely optimal for us.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: And if I contemplate the future? That would be such a drag. My standards are much lower than yours. As long as things are decently sorted, they're good enough for me.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: I suppose so.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: I am not one to preach the Church of the Deep's words, but that was me as well. There is no point in hating myself.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: If anyone wants to know the difference, then let them listen to me talk. I will settle for giving them a hard time.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Is this how you used to be?
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Perhaps, Dr. Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Besides, I finally have some old friends here with me, not some landlubber that I wouldn't know how to talk to, even if I wanted to talk. You know, they haven't even seen seaweed before.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: You could teach them.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: You still have a lot of new friends at that place you can now go back to.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: In the future, your colleagues will need you. I will need all of you as well.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: We need you.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Besides—
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Well, don't come home too late!
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: This doctor is never late, Specter.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Let's go, hunters. We'll leave the rest to her. She can take it.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Wait, Captain. I still have something to tell her.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Lady Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Deploying without any approval again, Skadi.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: At least you knew well enough to talk to Engineering and get them to prepare that case for you. They contacted me straight away.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: You're doing much better than before.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: I didn't expect you to actually come help me...
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: I told you, I'm a woman of my word, and that goes no matter what it is you are up to.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Now go home to Rhodes Island. Enjoy your vacation.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Kal'tsit glances at Skadi.
She doesn't say anything but starts smiling.
All of us have things that are simply beyond our abilities. Even Dr. {@nickname} struggles from time to time.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Our technology is not yet able to cure your infection... And neither can you.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: But, Specter, not being able to eradicate it doesn't mean you can't defeat it.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: You can't exterminate shadows, but you can make them your friend.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Skadi...
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: There isn't much you can do about your dark fate... but you can learn to work alongside it.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Perhaps only you can wrestle tooth and nail with it till the end of times.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Oh, it's you, singer! You are back!
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Huh? Where's your sax... uh... saxophone?
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: No idea...
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Oh, don't worry. I'm sure you left it somewhere around here. I'll help you look for it.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Also, about your harp. You dropped it yesterday. I've been holding onto it for you.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: It's yours now.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: I can have it... Just like we promised? Does that mean you've found your friend? That's great news, singer. I'm so happy for you!
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: But... you look really tired... You look more tired than you were last night. Are you hurt?
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: I... It's okay. I'm just a little dizzy.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Well, okay. I didn't see you, and I was so worried you ran into some kind of trouble.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Something really amazing happened just now. Did you see that? There was an explosion, then another. Like, bang bang bang, boooom! The mountain over that way kept shaking, and then it suddenly came crashing down!
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: I thought our house would come crashing down too.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Are you all okay?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: We're fine. The only problem is that all our food is still inside. It's already rotten. Erm, we'll probably go hungry for a while again.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: It's all thanks to the Inquisitor. She was the one who told us to leave the house and to stay away from the coast and the chapel up on the hill.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: She helped you.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Yeah, she's such a nice person. She protected us the whole time.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Ahem.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Got a sore throat?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: *cough* *cough*— Y-You wretch! No matter, I will let you off the hook just this once. Tsk, you're a lucky one, Ægir. The High Inquisitor didn't take you away.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: You've been waiting for me.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: I knew you'd be back... I have something to tell you.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Still haven't given up?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: What...? Why are you in a fighting stance? I haven't even drawn my weapon!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: W-What I'm trying to say is... I'm sorry I was so harsh with you before.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: I'm not the kind of person... who doesn't apologize when she's done wrong. I may be an Inquisitor, but when an Inquisitor makes a mistake, she needs to reflect on it all the more.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: When you first stepped into the town, I saw you right away. I could tell you were an Ægir, costume or no. You are different.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: At the time... I was angry, and my passions were inflamed. I thought I had finally found the answer. The evil outsiders, the culprit who brought this misfortune to us—
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: I thought that by dragging you out here and defeating you... I could right the wrongs and solve our problems. I thought it was that simple.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: But I am no match for you, and what could defeating you change anyway?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: The real threat that this city and all Iberia faces is not a single Ægir or two.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: You've grown...
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Much thanks to you...
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: I can't think the way I used to think anymore. What happened here has left me bewildered to the point that I'm not sure how I'd judge anything again.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: I am an inquisitor. It is my duty to eradicate the threats that Iberia faces in order to uphold its order.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: —You are a threat, but are you our enemy?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Then we have the people here. Should I protect them, or should they be eliminated?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: And what if I can't make sense of it? What, then, is my reason for taking up the sword? It will leave me directionless, stuck in the same spot, just like the people here.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Then—It was you and the locals who helped me see things clearly.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: I can't save the inhabitants... It probably sounds strange, but once I realized this, I made the decision to protect them.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: At the very least, at that very moment and right now, I know what is right and what is wrong.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: As for you, you did the right thing. You protected this place... for the time being, at least. That is much more than I have ever done for these people.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: You did the right thing too.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: What I did was no different from what you did.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: What do you mean, no different...? No matter, you are just as terrible at giving comfort as you are at disguises.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: You wanted comfort from me?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: What do you...? No, no thank you.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Good. I don't have any for you either.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: So, you found the answer you were looking for?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: I don't need it anymore.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: I've asked too many questions. I found my answer, and once I calmed down, I realized those answers meant nothing really. Just like you, I know which way I am headed now.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Oh? Seems we're both ready.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: It's about time I get going, and I know it's time for you to go as well. You have gone free, so you must've come to some kind of agreement with the High Inquisitor.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Well... Goodbye.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: As long as we're still chasing the same goal, perhaps we will see each other again somewhere.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Huh? Did the Inquisitor leave? What a shame. I want her to see what I'm making.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: What's this...?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: It's the seaweed alcohol you taught me to make! Uh, is this looking okay? Are the pieces too big still?
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: They are way too small.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Huh? Let me try again. It's okay. We don't have any food left, but we still have plenty of seaweed. If we run out, I'll get some more from Uncle Fireplace.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: You will get better.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Once I'm finished... Uh... You'll be gone by the time I'm finished, right? You came here to tell me this, didn't you? You are leaving.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Yes, I'm leaving.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: (Subconsciously kneads the seaweed)
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Right, you're a wandering singer. You wander, only stopping once in a while.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Will you ever come back? I... I want to listen to you play your harp and sing some more. Grandma Petra and Drywall, they do too.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Yes, I will.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: My friends, too. We can come together.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: That sounds great!
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: It's a promise, okay? Be sure to come back soon! I will be waiting for you here.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Woodframe.
attributes.name: Inhabitant

attributes.content: Uh, here! Singer, they need me for something. I gotta go.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Don't forget what you promised!
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: That can there...
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: The red shell.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Anita!
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.text: Just as she said she would, the girl stops in her tracks, turns around, and smiles at Skadi.

attributes.content: Yes?
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: If next we meet on the outside, I'll still sing for you.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Okay! Looks like I gotta keep your harp in my box.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: See you, singer!
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: See you.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Dammit.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Dammit!
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Gladiia caresses her face in the mirror.
Look at you. You still ended up an ugly bitch in the end.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: You should've died in the deep sea. Is this what you wanted? You should've died with everyone else instead of going into hiding here. Constantly on edge, no matter what you do, even breathing, much less letting them hear your singing.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: You have to shut yourself up in a landship's bathroom just to complain about your predicament, never again to ride the waves. All you can do is to wait until you fully transform into a beast.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Look, this is you.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: It's too soon... Too soon.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: The ship... I need to find that ship.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.text: A Seaborn tried to get an answer from Skadi... The monsters tried to pry the truth from their murderers.
Which also means that the hunters still have a chance, perhaps their one and only chance—

attributes.content: Before the waves engulf the world and those monstrous colossi summon their bloodkin, we must smother the sea with silence. Its brood will know nothing of this.
We will exterminate them at their source.
This is our only chance. This will bring about a calamity... but Ægir will get its moment of reprieve.
I can't hear Ægir. Heh, just like the monsters waiting in vain for their revelations.
Nonetheless, we have a responsibility. The Abyssal Hunters must be the first to uncover Iberia's secrets.
—The last dreadnought of the Iberian fleet. Indomitable, yet disappearing without a trace in the span of a night.
Gladiia stops gazing at herself in the mirror.
This is my duty. I must defend Ægir.
By capturing that golden ship and taking hold of that key, the doors to the vault will fling wide open, and the volcano shall be unleashed.
